Hard Disk Information Temperature: Time: Model: Serial Num: Disk Size: %1$d ℃ Current Mode：%1$s
Format Hard Disk Format Hard Disk Select Hard Disk Mode RAID0 Mode Two hard disks are virtually merged into a single hard disk. The capacity is the sum of the two disks. The access speed is fast, but any one hard disk is damaged and the data of the other hard disk is also lost. RAID1 Mode More data protected Writes identical data to both drives simultaneously Provides data redundancy LVM mode That is to clear the internal hard disk data and expand the capacity. In this way, while expanding the storage space through the external hard disk, all the data in your existing internal hard disk will be cleared. Therefore, please choose carefully! LVM ADD mode (recommended when adding a hard disk) That is, retain the original internal hard disk data and expand the capacity. In this way, while expanding the storage space through the external hard disk, the data in your existing internal hard disk is still retained. Note: After the device is connected to the external hard disk, please do not remove it. When the formatted external hard drive is removed, the internal hard drive will not work properly. If you really need to remove the external hard drive, and then connect a new hard drive or only use the internal hard drive, you must format the device again before you can access the device\'s internal hard drive space.

There are two ways for an administrator to remove a device:\n First, only remove yourself;\n Second, remove all users of the current device.\n Delete Account Are you sure to delete this account and data? Location Backup to Are you sure you want to remove this login ? Erasing disk will delete all data stored on it, and cannot be undone.During this process, please keep the power and network, do not restart or shut down the device.
